title: Ticket #767: Updating some of 7.4 parameter defaults to modern machines
description:
Out of the ~1500 or so parameters available in the condor configuration, we are to update around ~620 of them to be current for modern machines, if applicable. This means changing:
  1. The code location(s) where the default is often hard coded
  2. The default table specified in param_info.in
  3. The condor_config.generic configuration file

I have a tool which will dig around in the Condor source and map each entry to the locations in the source code which deals with it. This tool is not fool proof, however I did try and make it catch 99% of the cases.

Changes to 7.5 defaults

All changes should be made as early as possible in the 7.5 series.

Changes to 7.4 defaults

We will perform a small number of changes to the default parameters for 7.4. They are:

  • MAX_JOBS_RUNNING
  • START_LOCAL_UNIVERSE
  • START_SCHEDULER_UNIVERSE
  • SHADOW_SIZE_ESTIMATE
  • RESERVED_SWAP
  • NEGOTIATOR_INTERVAL
  • Convert HOSTALLOW/DENY to be ALLOW/DENY
  • ENABLE_GRID_MONITOR
  • GRIDMANAGER_MAX_SUBMITTED_JOBS_PER_RESOURCE

Please inspect their proposed defaults in the table.

Higher Level Tasks

  1. Create a $(TMP) macro which has the correct value in it for any arch.
  2. Maybe instrument param to shove into a database the parameters it looks up so we can determine what it is doing at a more fine grained level.
  3. Remove the *_EXPRS format and replace wholesale with *_ATTRS.
  4. Unify VMWARE_ and VM_ namespaces.
  5. Rethink MAX_JOBS_RUNNING as instead an expression which using things like available virtual & physical memory, number of available bindable ports, amount of disk space available in spool, knowledge if a job is a remotely or locally executed entity, decides on an amount of jobs, which could simply be 0 or 1 initially) that can be run in an iteration of the schedd trying to run jobs.

Table Defaults

Here follows the current defaults. If there were any spaces in the default value, the default value is surrounded by tick marks to make it apparent it is a literal value.

Ultimately, we don't yet detect the correct pieces of information, like available bindable ports, that we need to get this right.

remarks:
2009-Oct-08 20:07:27 by matt:
ENABLE_SOAP does indeed control if SOAP connections are enabled, a default of true is good though.

The SOAP params came into existence before the SUBSYS. notation and thus have a SUBSYS_ notion. All that code should be simplified. [15997]

If FILE_LOCK_VIA_MUTEX indeed does what it suggests and avoids advisory locks on file then it should be promoted and documented. It could be very useful in environments where fcntl is unreliable.

Don't remove GLOBAL_JOB_ID_WITH_TIME.

Do we know if the GRIDSHELL still works, if not it should be removed instead of documented.

There are a number of different UPDATE_INTERVAL params, they should be unified, and specialized using the SUBSYS. functionality if necessary.

The HA_LOCK_HOLD_TIME is insanely long. We should recognize that HA via the Master is primarily there for HA Schedds and change the HOLD_TIME to a fraction of the default claim lease duration to avoid as much bad put as possible.

LOCAL_UNIV_EXECUTE -> LOCAL_UNIVERSE_EXECUTE for consistency.

Note on HAD_ namespace, HAD is a SUBSYS, consider HAD. .

MPI_ namespace should become PARALLEL_? Or be removed?

NEGOTIATOR_STATE_FILE and STATE_FILE should be removed in favor of NEGOTIATOR.SPOOL, for when relocating the Accountantnew.log is desired.

We should remove QUILL_ and isolate it in a plugin.

RELEASE_DIR should not be param'd for, fix the code that does.

HDFS_DATANODE_DIR should not be /scratch/tmp.

HDFS_HOME should use $(LIBEXEC).

STARTD_SENDS_ALIVES has had some discussion and may have downsides, please explore before switching this.

USE_AFS and USE_NFS are Standard Universe specific and should be identified as such, they confuse people.

VM_MAX_MEMORY, VM_MAX_NUMBER and VM_MEMORY should go the way of the dodo.

Merge the XEN_ namespace with VM_ and VMWARE_.

2009-Oct-09 07:52:08 by danb:
Our proposed expression for MAX_JOBS_RUNNING references SHADOW_SIZE_ESTIMATE. Without the default param table, this reference will give back nothing, unless this variable is explicitly set in the config file. The unfortunate thing about setting it in the config file is that if somebody upgrades from 7.4 without upgrading their default config file, whatever default we put in the param table will not take effect, because it will be explicitly set in the config file. To make matters worse, this variable was explicitly set in the default config file prior to 7.4. It was set to 1800, which seems rather high.

I chose to simply insert a number (800k) directly into the MAX_JOBS_RUNNING expression, rather than reference SHADOW_SIZE_ESTIMATE.

2009-Oct-09 07:59:48 by danb:
Greg T was wondering if we could provide a script for converting old config files (e.g. for doing the HOSTALLOW --> ALLOW switch). A naive script would mess things up in the following case: 

ALLOW_WRITE = blah1
HOSTALLOW_WRITE = blah2

-->

ALLOW_WRITE = blah1
ALLOW_WRITE = blah2

That's wrong, because in the first config, the allow list is "blah1 blah2" whereas in the second it is "blah2".

2009-Oct-09 09:27:08 by jfrey:
FILE_LOCK_VIA_MUTEX only works on Windows.

It turns out USE_NFS and USE_AFS are used in the new shadow/starter for the I/O proxy.

2009-Oct-19 20:35:31 by matt:
USE_NFS and USE_AFS should be renamed to more clearly express what they do in which context. As for their use in the new shadow, a quick looks suggests it is a little suspect.

2009-Nov-03 23:28:35 by matt:
Simplification of SETTABLE_ATTRS, see #903

2009-Nov-04 16:03:19 by psilord:
In the context of 7.4, this ticket is pretty much done since the new param system was turned off for 7.4, and only the recommended changes happened, documentation included. I'm not sure what to mark this ticket as since it clearly isn't active, but shouldn't be resolved.

Since most of the work on this ticket is for 7.5, I'll defer it for now until that time when the changes for 7.5 can be done.

derived_tickets: #1141   default session duration is 3600 in 7.5.0
check_ins:
2010-Feb-12 16:15   Check-in [25270]: Documented fix for spurious EXECUTE_LOGIN_IS_DEDICATED warning. #767 (By Dan Bradley )
2010-Feb-12 16:00   Check-in [17227]: Removed EXECUTE_LOGIN_IS_DEDICATED from the param table. #767 This is a deprecated config knob. Its presence in the param table was causing warnings to be emitted in the logs. (By Dan Bradley )
2009-Oct-13 10:23   Check-in [16033]: Clear ALLOW as well as HOSTALLOW, now that default config file sets ALLOW. #767 (By Dan Bradley )
2009-Oct-13 10:23   Check-in [16034]: Changed default for NEGOTIATOR_INTERVAL from 300 to 60 in the schedd code. #767 (By Dan Bradley )
2009-Oct-12 15:34   Check-in [25023]: Documented default configuration value changes. #767 (By Dan Bradley )
2009-Oct-09 22:37   Check-in [15997]: Eliminated the SUBSYS_ nonsense when configuring SOAP, it predated the SUBSYS. notation. Also, removed soap_core's dependence on get_mySubSystem. [...] (By Matthew Farrellee )
2009-Oct-09 18:47   Check-in [15981]: Fixed default for MAX_JOBS_RUNNING in param table. #767 The expression is a big ugly because of the lack of a min() function. (By Dan Bradley )
2009-Oct-09 18:27   Check-in [15977]: Changed default GRIDMANAGER_MAX_SUBMITTED_JOBS_PER_RESOURCE from 100 to 1000. #767 (By Dan Bradley )
2009-Oct-09 18:27   Check-in [15978]: Changed default MAX_JOBS_RUNNING from 200 to something more appropriate. #767 The new default is min($(DETECTED_MEMORY)*0.8*1024/800,10000). In Windows, we additionally cap this at 200. [...] (By Dan Bradley )
2009-Oct-09 18:27   Check-in [15979]: Changed default RESERVED_SWAP from 5 to 0. #767 This effectively disables the checking of swap space for shadows. We believe the new default for MAX_JOBS_RUNNING does a more appropriate calculation shadow memory requirements. (By Dan Bradley )
2009-Oct-09 18:27   Check-in [15980]: Changed default TotalLocalJobsRunning and TotalSchedulerJobsRunning. #767 These both limit their respective job types to 200 max running. We chose to make these limits independent of each other to keep things simple and avoid issues with starvation. (By Dan Bradley )
2009-Oct-09 18:27   Check-in [15975]: Changed default NEGOTIATOR_INTERVAL from 300 to 60. #767 (By Dan Bradley )
2009-Oct-09 18:27   Check-in [15976]: Changed ENABLE_GRID_MONITOR default in param table to true to match param call site. #767 (By Dan Bradley )
2009-Oct-09 14:08   Check-in [25020]: Documented ALLOW/DENY change in default config file. #767 (By Dan Bradley )
2009-Oct-08 11:53   Check-in [15948]: Converted HOSTALLOW/HOSTDENY to ALLOW/DENY in all examples. For years, the manual has claimed that HOSTALLOW/HOSTDENY are the old deprecated way to do things. This makes it confusing when people try to follow examples in the manual and their new ALLOW/DENY settings get merged with the default config [...] (By Dan Bradley )
